title: Service Portal
content:
Service Portal provides one centralized location for all employee issues related to IT. Its easy-to-use interface enables users to independently request and track support and service requests, search for a knowledge article, and browse a service catalog. 

The portal's sophisticated search capabilities enable users to independently find relevant information. Search results are gathered from multiple sources and can include multimedia-rich articles, relevant services and forms, and targeted support – all displayed in one, user-friendly interface.

Category tiles

In Service Portal, when a user clicks a category tile, a page is displayed with the following tabbed sections:

  • Featured (hidden by default) - displays news, recommended & popular offerings, and articles
  • Offerings - displays all offerings that belong to the category
  • Articles - displays relevant articles that belong to the category
  • News - displays relevant news that belong to the category

The category page also includes an enhanced search drop-down option, allowing the user to search the selected category or all categories.

Submit a service request

The suite provides a shopping cart system for users in Service Portal to collect and submit requests for multiple goods and services. As each item is added to or removed from the cart, the total number of items is updated and displayed beside the cart image. The user can click the cart image to edit or remove items, change item quantity, and submit them.

Adding to cart is not supported for case requests.

After your request is submitted, you can also:

  • Add comments or attachments to your request
    If the content of the comment exceeds 10,000 characters (including embedded HTML tags), a warning appears and you can't save the comment.
  • Accept or reject solutions and close the request
  • Open a live chat on the request

If you need to attach a file to your request, the file must be a supported file type. This is controlled by an attachment allowlist that your suite administrator has defined in Suite Administration. Out of the box, the following file types are supported: gif, jpeg, jpg, png, xls, xlsx, csv, txt, bmp, tif, tiff, log, pkb, and eml. 

Copy a request

The Copy Request button is disabled by default. You must contact the support team to enable it.

You can click the Copy Request button to create requests based on an existing request. For example, you can request a new piece of equipment several times and generate multiple individual requests quickly from a single initial request, without having to enter the same information multiple times. 

The Copy request button displays on the request details page when:

  • The current login user is the Request by or Request for person of this request.
  • The current login user has Create permission of request records.
By default, the value of Requested for will be copied to the new request in both normal mode and request on behalf mode. If users want to change the Requested for person for the new request, you can request your tenant administrator to add the Requested for field to the request check out form. The users can then change the value of Requested for during request copy process.

Limitations

  • You cannot create a new request from a cart request.
  • You can copy a request only if you are the Request by or Request for person, even when the request is public or one you follow.

Submit a smart ticket

A smart ticket can be easily submitted through the New request button. You only need to describe the problem or send its images as attachments on the submit page. IDOL will automatically recognize the text you entered or scan the text on the images, and then categorize the ticket. To enable this feature, you need to configure the New request link in Ribbon promotion of Feature Settings.

Search for information

To search for information, follow these steps:

  1. On the Service Portal main page, enter one or more key words in the search box at the top left corner and then click the search icon.
  2. If no information was found, you can optionally submit a support request: 
    1. Click the create a standard support request link.
    2. Upload a screenshot of your problem or enter the problem description.
    3. Click SUBMIT.
When you search for a request, only the public requests, or the requests which are opened or closed by yourself can be searched out. Other requests, including those requests you are following, can’t be searched out.

Request on behalf

To make a request on behalf of another person:

  1. On the Service Portal main page, click the menu button   at the top left of the page.
  2. Click Request on behalf.
  3. Select a person from the drop-down list.

When a user in Service Portal makes a request on behalf of another person, the following effects take place:

  • Ideas aren't displayed
  • Requests that are displayed are those of the user
  • Offering availability is based on the entitlement rules applicable to the other person
  • Prices (if any) are displayed based on the entitlement rules applicable to the other person
  • Carts and their requests are submitted in the name of the other person

Ask friends

If you have a question, you can click the Ask Friends icon on the Service Portal main page to post your question.

Help friends

You can click the Help Friends icon on the Service Portal main page to help answering questions asked by other Service Portal users.

Suggest idea

If you have any ideas to share, do the following:

  1. Click the Suggest Idea icon.
  2. Enter a title and description, and then click Continue.
  3. If needed, add one or more attachments, and then click SAVE AS DRAFT to publish it later or click PUBLISH to publish it immediately.

View services and assets

To view your services and assets, follow these steps:

  1. In the Service Portal, click the portal menu at the top left of the page.
  2. Select Services and Assets.
  3. You can see two tabs on the Services and Assets page, one for subscriptions and one for CIs. 
    • Subscriptions tab: Displays the subscription records based on the selected owner. If the subscription is associated with a CI, the CI information is also included in the subscription detail page. 
      • For Cloud subscriptions, select the subscription from the list to view its details. 
        • There is a short delay after a state change with a service instance before the Service Portal is updated to reflect that change. In particular, the Actions dropdown may take a minute to reappear after certain state changes. Examples of such state changes include the modification of a subscription completing successfully or a Reset Modification or Fail Modification (performed by an operator) completing.
        • When a cloud subscription is in the Active status, you can modify and cancel the cloud subscription, and manage the corresponding service instance from the subscription detail page in the Service Portal.  When a cloud subscription is in the Pending or Terminated status, you can only cancel the subscription because the cloud service is being deployed or the deployment has failed. 
        • If an operator performs a Fail Modification operation on a subscription, the Modify subscription action will no longer be available in the Actions dropdown for the subscription. For more information, see Resume, reset, or fail an instance paused during modification.
      • Select drop-down Actions to view the following options for the cloud subscription.
        • Manage service instance - Select this option to view the service instance details. For each of the components, Actions will be displayed as per the actions designed in the service design.
        • Cancel subscription - Select this option to cancel the subscription.
        • Modify subscription - Select this option to open the Modify Subscription Details view. Modify the parameters as per your requirements and submit the request.
        • Transfer subscription (for cloud subscriptions only) - Select this option to transfer the subscriber of the cloud subscriptions to another user. See Transfer subscriptions.
    • Services & Assets tab: Displays the CIs whose owner is the selected owner. However, if there is a subscription for the CI and the subscriber is also the CI owner, the CI information is included in the subscription detail page from the Subscriptions tab instead of being listed in the Services & Assets tab.

Delegate approvals

You can configure Service Management to have your approvals delegated to another user.

To do this, follow these steps:

  1. In Service Portal, click the portal menu at the top left of the page.
  2. Click Delegations.

You can have only one delegation. If you have already a delegation, you have to delete it first by clicking Remove before you can create a new one.

  1. Complete the delegation form to specify to whom you want to delegate your approvals and the delegation start and end dates.
  2. Click Save.

For more information, see Delegate approvals.

Chat with the virtual agent

You can click the Virtual Agent icon on the Service Portal main page to post your question. Service Portal automatically answers your question with a list of KM articles, news, support offerings, or service offerings, which enables you to view the existing solutions. If no options are available, you can either click the Create a standard support request link provided to create a standard support request or click the Chat with a live agent link to obtain support from a live agent.

Note: By design, Create a standard support request and Chat with a live agent use different forms. The form used for the Create a standard support request depends on your setting. The Chat with a live agent doesn’t use the smart ticket form, the other behavior is the same as Create a standard support request.

Preferences and Skills

  • You can set the language and your avatar in the Preferences page.

    - Supported image types for avatar: GIF, JPG, JPEG, PNG and AVIF. Maximum file size for avatar: 10 MB.
    - Because of a known issue, your change to the language setting is temporary and your language setting will be automatically changed to empty or English later. If you want to change the language setting permanently, contact your administrator to prevent it from being overwritten again via editing the People UI.

  • You can add your skills in the Skills page. 
    • The featured questions and your interested ideas are displayed according to your skills added to your profile.
    • When a user asks a question in Service Portal, some other users will get notifications to help answering this question according to the skills added to their profiles and the questions they have answered before.

Activate mobile app

For more information, see Service Portal mobile app.

Theme settings

For more information, see Service Portal display theme settings.
